law.catch_line: Enrollee choice of primary care providers.

text.section: An enrollee shall have adequate choice among participating primary care providers in a managed care plan who are accessible and qualified.

A managed care plan shall permit enrollees to choose their own primary care provider from a list of health care providers within the plan. This list shall be updated as health care providers are added or removed and shall include a sufficient number of primary care providers who are accepting new enrollees.
Women shall be able to choose a qualified health care provider offered by a plan for the provision of covered care necessary to provide routine and preventive women's health care services.

An insurer shall provide a covered person with access to a consultation with a participating health care provider for a second opinion. Obtaining the second opinion shall not cost a covered person more than the covered person's normal copay or coinsurance amounts.

law.history: Amended 2004 Ky. Acts ch. 59, sec. 7, effective July 13, 2004. -- Amended 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 262, sec. 25, effective July 14, 2000. -- Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 496, sec. 29, effective April 10, 1998.
